McGovern-Dole International Food for Education and Child Nutrition Program Grants

description.narrative: The workshop was organized by USAID in collaboration with USDA-APHIS-IS. The program aimed to strengthen the capacity of border veterinary services to ensure safe trade of animal goods in implementing science based rules and principles relating to inspection and certification enacted by the OIE and WTO. The Presentations and demonstrations focused on International principles and rules regarding Inspection and certification, Country experiences, US Experience, visits and demonstrations at Paga border and the Airport of Ouagadougou and the Harmonization program of veterinary certificates for poultry and poultry products in West Africa implemented by FAO/ECTAD.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: McGovern-Dole International Food for Education and Child Nutrition Program Grants
McGovern-Dole International Food for Education and Child Nutrition Program Grants

title.narrative: Poultry diseases detection, Biosecurity in Farms/Live birds Markets/Sampling procedures for lab tests.

description.narrative: The goals were intended to reinforce and strengthen existing ability for surveillance and diagnosis of avian diseases including highly pathogenic avian influenza, exotic Newcastle Disease, Gumboro, Salmonella and Mycoplasma as well as to reinforce and strengthen understanding of best practices for biosafety and biosecurity. The training was held at the Central Veterinary Laboratory of Ouagadougou (CVL).

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

description.narrative: The Borlaug Fellowship Program promotes food security and economic growth by providing training and collaborative research opportunities to fellows from developing and middle-income countries.

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Foreign Agricultural Service, Salaries and Expenses

description.narrative: The Food for Progress Program provides for the donation of U.S. agricultural commodities to developing countries and emerging democracies that are committed to introducing or expanding free enterprise in their agricultural economies. The program has two primary strategic objectives: (1) increase agricultural productivity and (2) expand trade of agricultural products.

description.narrative: The McGovern-Dole program provides for the donation of agricultural commodities and the provision of financial and technical assistance to improve the education, food security and health of school-age children, especially girls, in developing countries.

description.narrative: The McGovern-Dole program provides for the donation of agricultural commodities and the provision of financial and technical assistance to improve the education, food security and health of school-age children, especially girls, in developing countries.

description.narrative: The Borlaug Fellowship Program promotes food security and economic growth by providing training and collaborative research opportunities to fellows from developing and middle-income countries.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Scientific Cooperation Research Program - Fertilizer Optimization

description.narrative: The Scientific Cooperation Research Program supports joint research, extension, and education projects lasting up to two years among domestic and international agricultural professionals. These projects address issues including agricultural trade and market access, animal and plant health, biotechnology, food safety and security, and sustainable natural resource management.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Local and Regional Food Aid Procurement Pilot Project

description.narrative: Through the Local and Regional Food Aid Procurement (LRP) Program, FAS is authorized to partner with private voluntary organizations, cooperatives, and the World Food Program to implement field-based projects that provide development assistance and emergency relief using locally procured commodities. The LRP program complements existing U.S. government food assistance programs, especially the McGovern-Dole International Food for Education and Child Nutrition Program, which supports school feeding and maternal and child nutrition projects around the world.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date
